body.directions: Listen to the audio, and then complete the multiple-choice questions that follow.

body.textVersion: Audio for 坐火车 zuòhuǒchē (to ride a train)

body.quiz: For which of the following trips will you most likely consider the method of transportation indicated by the word in the audio?
body.answer: To my cousin’s house in the next city
options: To the farmers market in town
body.correct: Job excellently done! 坐火车 zuòhuǒchē means “to ride a train,” and you most likely need it when visiting somewhere farther than getting around town.
body.incorrect: Not quite… Listen to the word in the audio again to identify its meaning. Then, review the different situations to see for which one this transportation method makes the most sense.

body.quiz: Which of the following will you need the most when taking the transportation method indicated by the word in the audio?
body.correct: Very nicely done! 出租车 chūzūchē means “taxi,” and to ride a taxi, you will need money more than you need a book.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the word again. Identify its meaning. Then review the words in the choices, and imagine which item will help you the most when you use this type of transportation.

body.textVersion: Audio for 巴士站 bāshìzhàn (bus station)

body.quiz: What does the third character in the word in the audio mean?
body.correct: Fantastic job! The character 站 zhàn in the word 巴士站 bāshìzhàn (bus station) means “station,” which is also the third character in the word 消防站 xiāofángzhàn (fire station).
body.incorrect: Almost there! Listen to the audio several more times to identify the third character, and then consider its meaning. Think about any words you learned before that have the same third character.

body.textVersion: Audio for 走路 zǒulù (to walk (to somewhere))

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can be best completed by the word in the audio?
body.correct: Amazing job! 走路 zǒulù means “to walk (to somewhere),” and the sentence that it can best complete is 我走路去公园。 Wǒ zǒulù qù gōngyuán. (I walk to the park.)
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the audio again and consider its meaning. Then, review all four sentences in the choices to see for which one this word can fit most reasonably.

body.textVersion: Audio for 骑单车 qídānchē (to ride a bike)

body.quiz: How many wheels does the transportation indicated in the audio have?
body.correct: Very nicely done! 单车 dānchē in the audio means “bike,” not a sixteen-wheeler, and it has two wheels.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the audio again, and identify the mode of transportation mentioned in it. Then think about what it looks like and how many wheels it has.
